intro: Tragacantha sancta, commonly known as holy thorn, is a perennial shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its spiny stems and small, pale green leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by distinctive orange or red pods. Its latex sap has been traditionally used in herbal medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties. The botanical features of Tragacantha sancta make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
